授業目的: Students will learn about Japan's external relations from the mid-nineteenth century to the present. Lectures will tend to focus on U.S.-Japan relations. Attention will be given to Sino-Japanese and Sino-American relations. Due to the ongoing pandemic class might be held online. The access link in each class session is subject to cancellation or change when class begins in April.
到達目標: Students should be able to know and understand the basic aspects of Japan's external relations as seen through its relations with the U.S. from the 1850s to the present.
授業方法:
All students taking this couse will do so by accessing to on-demand content for class session 3（April 22）onwards. We will NOT physically meet in classroom. I will meet with students via Zoom for the first ten minutes or so starting at 1:20 pm and thereafter students go get access to their on-demand content.

Please be sure to attend the first class in class or via Zoom. For the Zoom access link, please see the details in the first class session that start with the word "Orientat" or at the end of this section; this access link is scheduled to be used for subsequent sessions.This class is scheudled to meet face-to-face; students who are unable to attend may take this course based on an on-demand format This class is conducted by using lecture materials and students are supposed to read the relevant sections of the textbook before the lecture.
